reviewText: I was so excited to hear this was coming to DVD ( My Three Sons),  but when i read the reviews here. CBS/Paramount When are you guys going to learn not to mess with customers that pay your salaries? I guess you just want to lose customers left and right, first you screwed up with The Fugitive - Season Two, Vol. 1, then The Beverly Hillbillies and now this ! get with the program, i'm to a fan of these classic shows and want an unedited version with no original music missing or scenes etc. I guess i will have to wait alittle  longer until you get you're act together,too bad. i wanted to get this DVD set for my dad for christmas, but  i guess i'll have to wait. you shot yourself in the foot by replacing the music and some footage i've heard. i'm not getting that edited set are you crazy? oh well hopefully you'll get your act together like i said. i'll purchase this title when it is  the unedited version with original music/scenes  intacted in the future, same thing with the other titles mentioned that you screwed over. when will you learn?Maybe The Person In charge of Making These Bad Decisions ought to be Fired or Demoted to Different Department i hope so you are really making alot of fans mad with this practice. Just give people what they want simple as that.

reviewText: Here we go again!!!  CBS/Paramount does it again with releasing TV shows in volumes.  First, the Streets of San Francisco, Cannon and the Fugitive(which all the original music was taken out of).  But, a thirty-minute sitcom???  Give a me break!!!  What a bunch of BS!!!  I AM JUST PLAIN SICK OF IT!!!  It seems to me (from my observation) that CBS/Paramount owns most of the rights for the television DVD market.  I don't have a problem with free enterprise, but, when you enable corporations to get greedy, THEY WILL GET GREEDY and nobody can stop them.  The ONLY real way to stop them, is to not buy from CBS/Paramount!!!  I give the show My Three Sons five stars and CBS/Paramount minus five stars!!!!  But the rating scale only goes down to one star TOO BAD!!!

reviewText: After receiving this product,I found it worth every penny spent.Can't waitfor the next volume.The quality is top of the line.If there are any changes in the format of any episodes,it is'nt noticeable.3 discs that contain a total of 18 episodes from season 1.Episodes included:Disc1:CHIP OFF THE OLD BLOCKTHE LITTLE RAGPICKERBUB IN THE OINTMENTCOUNTDOWNBROTHERLY LOVEADJUST OR BUSTDisc2:LADY ENGINEERCHIP'S HARVESTRAFT ON THE RIVERLONESOME GEORGESPRING WILL BE A LITTLE LATEMY THREE STRIKERSDisc3:THE ELOPEMENTMIKE'S BROTHERDOMESTIC TROUBLEBUB LEAVES HOMEMIKE IN A RUSHTHE BULLYNot only are the episodes funny,but they also pull on your heart strings.In the first episode,you learn that dad(steve)has been a widower for sixyears.Another episode explains Bub's commitment to steve and his three boys."MY THREE STRIKERS" is unique in so many ways.The dream sequences areemotionally haunting.In my personal opinion,it drops the comedy aspect,todeal more on the personal relationships between all the main characters.Itstrays from the normal format of the series,but briefly goes back to theexpected comedy in the fadeout.It is a rather dark and edgey episode.Wellwritten,acted and very entertaining.I just wonder how fast they will release the next volume.Hopefully they will also include some bonus material.Like the sponser comercials done byall the actors.True it might not be the way we wanted it to be released,however it's now available.So put any disconcerns you have on theself,and buy it!Unless you want to wait another 10 plus years,and still noguarantee that it will be exactly the way you want it.I am totally thrilled beyond belief to collect the entire series,I'm not waiting anymore!

reviewText: I AM A 40 SOMETHING BABY BOOMER WHO GREW UP LOVING AND WATCHING MANY 60S SITCOMS, AS WELL AS THE THEN RE-RUNS OF MANY FROM THE 1950s. reviewText: Never in the relatively brief history of the DVD has there been such a prime example of a greedy, short sighted, narcissistic, indifferent QA/QC and downright mean spirited entity such as CBS/Paramount.At a time when family income is stretched, CBS/Paramount dangles classic American TV treasures before the eyes of the very core fans of the product; baby boomer families (AND their greatest generation parents; those fortunate to have them still) and now Gen X & Y's are finding series like 'My Three Sons' quite refreshing.  The media offered?  Exorbitantly priced half season sets, sets with music altered or completely replaced, grainy transfers full of artifactual trash, sets with edited footage & missing laugh tracks and so on.We as consumers must enjoin CBS/Paramount to realize that the American consumer ever so hungry for the media offered will just take but so much abuse before "Just Saying NO"!This offering ofMy Three Sons: The First Season, Vol. 1, (a perfect classic American TV treasure) at ~$1.50 per a 25 minute episode is a direct finger in the eye of a huge consumer demographic.  CBS/Paramount, I know you have heard our voices;  but you don't care enough to be listen!

reviewText: Would you buy "The Godfather" with different music?  Would you buy "The Wizard of Oz" without the color scenes?  I wouldn't think so.I have multiple problems with this DVD set:1.  Syndication!  This seems to be a growing epidemic among TV show releases.  ALF, Cosby Show, Roseanne, WKRP.  There are probably more that I'm not remembering currently.  And now My Three Sons.  Another classic butchered.  I can watch the same versions of the show on my local cable channel.2.  Music Substitution!  Paramount is very skimpy when it comes to this.  Seasons three and four of the Odd Couple were edited so severely that half the time the shows don't make sense anymore!  (If only Tony Randall were still alive; he could clean up Paramount's sloppy releases!)  Until Paramount discontinues to replace the original music, I will never buy another show from them again.3.  When you buy this package, you only get half the season!  And you have to spend an equal amount of money to get the "Season 1 volume 2" package!  It's shameless corporate greed.This set is truly a disappointment to "My Three Sons" fans and classic TV lovers in general.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Usually the folks at CBS/Paramount can be relied upon to release a quality product.  They're one of the few who routinely go back to the original 35mm camera negatives to produce their video masters.  Of course that wasn't the case with their awful looking release of the TV series CANNON, but in most cases their discs are of top quality.MY THREE SONS looks great, but unfortunately everything is undone by the misguided choice to replace all of the incidental music in the series with recently produced "synthesized" scores.  The show is ruined in the process.My collection now consists of over 6000 DVD's and Blu-rays (yes, it's an illness, but a fun one!) and I was so looking forward to MY THREE SONS.  After all, these early B/W episodes never showed up in syndication back when the series went into re-runs on local stations.  But after watching a few episodes of these new DVD's at a friend's house, I can say I will have nothing to do with them.  Too bad.  They look great, better than they ever have.  But the music ruins them.What's up CBS/Paramount?  Those of us who want the shows will now never buy them.  Those unfamiliar with the program will likely never plunk down the money you're asking.  Since fans won't want them now, who are these discs made for?? What a waste!
summary: How NOT to Release Classic Television

reviewText: I'm guilty. I've bought a lot of them, but now it's about time I STOP buying Paramount Television Shows. This "My Three Sons" release is the final straw.A few years ago, the music industry went apes**t when they learned that people were sharing MP3 music files. The music industry was losing so much money that they actually sued some of the people who were illegally down/up loading songs. They even sued a few teenagers and college students, just to prove a point and use them as an example. Now, Television DVD executives, answer these questions:Do you think us consumers are stupid? Would we buy a ZZ Top album knowing that some studio band was covering their songs? Don't you think that you are "Stealing" money from us unsuspecting consumers by giving us television season that are not complete or are "doctored"? Isn't this just as bad as people pirating a Metallica song?Either way, the person who should be getting what they deserve, the artists of the mp3 and the person buying season of My Three Sons or The Fugitive are being screwed. Maybe we should be going class-action on you!Our economy is in the toilet, and people are hurting for money. You have an intelligent group of people purchasing your DVD television sets, make them right and give the people what they want and deserve for their hard earned money. Or, just don't release the sets until you get everything right.
summary: Oh, Mister Television DVD Executive! Please Read This!

reviewText: This is a wonderful series and the lessons in it are certainly pertinent to today. They are very well thought out scripts. A great show to watch with your kids. How lucky they were to get Fred MacMurray to do this show!  As the mother of three sons myself I find it to be very relatable and not hokey or syrupy sweet nor is it profane like a lot of crap today.(Let's face it, Hollywood today doesn't have a clue about the real world. They seem to want to shape society rather than emulate it and since they are a bunch of self medicated power hungry baby rapers I can't relate to their present day regurgitation's. In goes the cocaine out comes the spew.)I am only speaking for the first volume of season one as that is the only one I have seen on DVD. I watched this as a child with my mother every week when it originally aired and the music sounds the same to me. I am confused about the people claiming some big change in the music.  As a devoted watcher of the original airings of the show I can't say I know what they are talking about. These episodes are in black and white for those of you who care one way or the other. It is well worth the current price and worth even more for those of us who loved and grew up with the show.
summary: Music sound the same to me! GREAT SHOW!

reviewText: Yep. Bad to split up 1/2 hr sitcom in 2 volumes. Some studios think we are stupid. This set should have been the full season at about street price of  $42 or $21 the Vol. At about 800 min the season, there are other sets that came out a lot longer. Mission Impossible at $36 for 1314 min. WOW. I am getting the first season, both volumes. My wife loved the show and I liked it. This lets Paramount know there is a demand. Then I'll wait for a more reasonable price.  When the Second Season goes flat, Paramount will wonder why. If they stop making any more I'll have a season. (Look at how many 1st season only Universal has put out.) If they figure it out, we will have the rest at a better price. BBC and A&E; prices are outrageous. Remember Dr. Quinn? It came out at $80 to $100 and is now at $20 to $40. Patience gets the spoils. Paramount, a little unreasonable considering that half of their buyers are senior citizens. Ops, my retirement portfolio dropped another 5%. Where can I save? Duhhhhh! Leave It to Beaver 1040 min for $22. Father Knows Best 660 min for $30. Donna Reed show 960 min $30. Flying Nun 617 min $17 (It was higher when it first came out.) Yep, this one is too expensive considering Donna Reed is as good a show for half the cost. Now if we can get this listing URL to a studio executive.I know there is a less of a demand for every decade the releases go back, thus harder to make a profit. Two ways are volume/low pricing or pricing high/low volume. Paramount has selected on pricing high/low volume. The logic is better to sell 50k copies and make $20 per set then 100k copies and make $7 per set.But if they sell 150k copies they would make more. I think they could sell at least 3 times more on a more reasonable full season pricing. But what do we know? I can not see anyone paying this price for all 12 Seasons.Update June 25, 2009: I noticed the price is now lower but at $1.60 25 min compared to Father Knows Best $1.13 The Loretta Young Show $ .95 Leave It to Beaver $.90 and the upcoming The Patty Duke Show $ 1.10 it has a way to drop yet. The best ever, Perry Mason is at $1.35 25 min.Update Feb 2 2011. Was 2 stars but now is 4 stars as the price is $16.49. Now I can get Vol 2 as it is $15.99.
summary: Why so high priced for an half season of an old show

reviewText: I wish I could understand how someone can write a bad review about a DVD set that has not even been released. Seems like this is starting to be a trend here on Amazon. People giving bad reviews on sets that are not due to be released for weeks or months. It seems there are some people out there that are hell bent on trying to ruin the enjoyment of collecting these wonderful old shows. And how sad it is that Amazon will allow this nonsense. I for one can not wait for this show to be released on DVD. And I really could care less about any small changes that "may" happen. Lets face it, releasing these old shows on DVD is not the main money maker for the studios producing them. I'm sure production could stop with no financial ruin to anyone involved. I'm wondering, has the world gotten so messed up that something as simple as purchasing a vintage TV show turns into a debate? Since I am a collector of most of the shows from the 50's and 60's I read the reviews posted by others. I believe in my heart and soul that some of the people think they are professionals in the field of movie and TV reviews and that their word is gospel. I'm sorry to say that many reviews just sound foolish. What it boils down to is this, people just need to mind their own business and Amazon needs take the first step in stopping poor reviews on DVDs that have not been released. And just for the record, I have no intention of reading any comments made to my statements because frankly I could care less.

reviewText: I watched 12 episodes of My 3 Sons today.  I broke down and purchased these DVD's because I wanted to see the beginning of this series.  MEtv Atlanta only show seasons 1965-1966 through 1969-1970.  I was a little girl in 1960; therefore, I don't remember any of the episodes shown during the first several years.  I would really like to purchase DVD's of the series from 1960-1965; but they are so pricey.  I will look for them af Sam's Club because they usually sell DVD's at a much lower price.  I enjoyed the episodes very much and actually like these a lot more than the ones made from 1965-1970.  The writing and acting is good.  Fred MacMurray as Steve Douglas is a very positive father role model.  As far as the music being different, I don't know.  This series is good, clean family fun.

reviewText: NOTE: I had originally written this review before I was aware that CBS/Paramount was altering their product through entire music score replacements and so on. As much as I love programs like "My Three Sons," I can't see the justification for such decisions as split-season releases or soundtrack altering. My five-star rating was originally for the show, not the product, and it can not be changed. That being said:The color episodes of this show were good too, but the episodes we prefer to watch are the black & white episodes with Mike (Steve's oldest son) and Bub (the boys' grandfather - Steve's father-in-law). It was a very different show, with such plots as Steve's neighbor wanting to take a pleasant Sunday drive with his wife and daughter, but ending up hoodwinked into taking Steve's car and about a dozen others with them; or Bub losing Chip's frog that he was going to use for show and tell. There was an episode where Rob was reading detective novels and became convinced that someone was following him. Another episode had Mike taking an umbrella stand made from a hippopotamus foot to his fraternity house where they used it so as to make it appear as though a giant beast walked into a nearby lake and never came out. One episode took place on the morning that daylight saving time ended, and Bub turned the clocks ahead instead of back, forcing a tired crew to roll out 2 hours early. The whole episode was staged to the narration of a NASA public info film that Chip was watching on TV.Some of what makes these episodes important is the way we see Chip and Ernie develop a close friendship prior to the 1965 adoption episode. These earlier episodes make that particular one more weighty and understandable. Thank goodness for Nick at Nite back in the late 80's, because I had never seen the black & whites in re-runs before they ran them, nor have I seen them run again. Makes me glad I recorded them! However, DVD season sets would be a very welcome addition to my collection.UPDATE: JUNE 23, 2008. CBS/Paramount has confirmed a release date for this series. "My Three Sons" Season 1, Volume 1 will be released September 30, 2008.Update: July 2, 2008: The rear cover art for this series mentions music changes. To what extent? Who knows. It is particularly sad to hear of this happening in this series as Frank DeVol's music was essential to the feel, thus the flow of these shows. One example that quickly comes to mind is an episode that I believe is called "The Horseless Saddle." There are two pieces of music used at crucial points throughout the episode, it's necessary that they be there. The saddle has it's own music, and the pony has it's own music, and I don't recall ever hearing these two pieces used again.There's also an episode where Mike becomes very serious about a girl he's met in college. He tells Steve about her and arranges for her to come for dinner and meet the family. She immediately becomes infatuated with Steve (Talking about him when she's out with Mike, even comparing him with John Wayne while they're at the movies) and begins phoning him and creating situations that bring them together. Again, there is not only a particular piece of music used each time she gives Steve a "look," but the same sound effect is also used and they really work well together.These shows without DeVol's music would be like a bun without a burger. Changing or deleting anything that's there would be a huge mistake!UPDATE: OCTOBER 1, 2008. Still waiting for a legitimate release.
Title: N/A

reviewText: people have been commenting here since 2005--waiting for this to be put on dvd. whoever owns the rights to this show should get it out quick! everyone in this country is longing for a more simple time (after what george bush has put us through). we yearn to go back to the days when we could afford a "bub" or "charlie" cooking for us, when we named the dog tramp, when it was a big deal to win a "letter", when taking guitar lessons was the event of the month (ok--i'm not sure if that was an episode, but i vaguely remember chip playing the guitar). release these shows already!
summary: Come On Already! Put This Out On DVD!

reviewText: Folks, I'm going to side-step reviewing this product and get directly to the crux of the problem: CBS/Paramount is destroying the nostalgic quality of many of these classic series as an easy way to avoid rights issues and then failing to notify the public of changes in order to maximize profits.Here's what you can do about it:1) Write polite letters to CBS/Paramount's television division expressing your dissatisfaction and unwillingness to continue buying their product unless it reflects the unedited series as it originally aired.2) Write cautionary reviews here and elsewhere that informs other prospective buyers/fans of the problems of this particular release.  BTW, don't mince words or hedge with 3 or 4 star ratings if you're dissatisfied because a consensus of mild negatives won't effectively register your dissatisfaction.  If you dislike the final result, then only a 1 star review will suffice.3) Write cautionary 1 star reviews for PRE-RELEASE titles of other series corresponding to the bogus 5 star reviews provided by overzealous fans who anticipate no problems.  Note: In explaining your reasoning always indicate which CBS/Paramount licensed series have been altered and that IF the upcoming title(s) that you're warning folks about are released without changes that you'll gladly revise your review and rating.RCC
Title: N/A

reviewText: if you are a true fan of a tv show....a die-hard fan....and it was available, with clean picture quality and remastering, and completely unedited, price would matter little. there is no way this show should be devided into 2 volumes per season, but i could even live with that. the b&w my three sons episodes are so rarely seen that if they wanted to charge me a high price for the set i'd probably bite. but there is no way im paying for an edited and altered version of this or any show. paramount did a good job with the brady bunch dvd's...no editing, original music. but lately its been an absolute embarrassment. and how stupid are these people? i mean, who are these sets marketed for? if they think the audience are people who never saw the show, then they would probably love it. but chances are the audience are folks who watched it, loved it, and know the difference between the original music and whatever this is!!! and, a favorite scene for the viewer could be anything! don't think because you (oh mighty editors at cbs/paramount) don't see the interest in a scene where someone steps out onto their front porch and picks up a newspaper, and it won't be missed...sorry, we know... enough is enough....i'd rather just remember the show the way it was than watch you guys butcher it!!!!
summary: price i can live with, editing and altering.. NO WAY!!!!!!!

reviewText: This was the best show ever.  A family getting along, while having fun, learning a lesson, and building character all at the same time.  All because Dad was a man of character with a great sense of humor.  What fun.  Fred MacMurray was one of the nicest people put on this earth and one of the best actors.  This show is definitely not a waste of time like so many other shows.  I would love to see all the seasons come to DVD!!!  PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE!!!!

reviewText: First of all, the 5 star rating is for the SHOW. I thought of leaving a 1 star rating as many others have, but it's a little confusing so I went the 5-stars-with-clarification road.Unfortunately Paramount showed the same greedy maneuvers with I Love Lucy episodes about 10 years ago. My husband innocently bought me 5 "volumes" with a mere 4 episodes each.  I was estactic because I had not seen an episode in many years. But my exitement turned sour when they released an entire season in SETS shortly thereafter. That's when we knew we'd been taken.Shame on the greedy producers for scamming the public like this!! Dangling a much beloved classic show like this in front of our noses. They can be ours - if we pay your price. Well not this time!  Give us the WHOLE season in sets - not divided up in volumes for maximum profit to pad your already overstuffed wallets.FOrtunately these My Three Sons volumes are available at my local public library and I have checked them out dozens of times and will continue to do so until I see the seasons released properly as a SET for a DECENT PRICE!So...5 stars for the show and ZERO for these dvd scams.
summary: LOVE THE SHOW BUT NOT THE PRODUCERS!

reviewText: Would you watch the Nutcracker Suite with your kid for Christmas if it were set to "Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap?"  No...unless you were a nut.  Since I'm not one, I won't partake in this charade of a DVD since it's gotten all the music replaced with some forgery and fraud of a music background.  Also, the attempt to rip me off by splitting seasons up with the sole purpose of a CASH GRAB to make more money, Paramount won't get a dime off me on this.As for the series itself, I never really liked it anyway except it was safe "white bread" entertainment for the masses with easy to follow stories.  I've got a daughter and she doesn't like all the "boy" stuff anyway.  I always thought "Uncle Charlie" was simply annoying and if he were my uncle, I'd have had him thrown out on his ear...but that's me.Don't buy this rubbish.  Wait for the series to be done right. Even I might get it if they did that.  Not this way. Not if h3ll froze over.
summary: Like watching "The Nutcracker Suite" set to AC/DC music.

reviewText: BULLETIN...BULLETIN...BULLETIN. IMPORTANT: Here are the facts, as of 10/24/2011. Has ABC/Paramount cleaned up their act? Looks like it. I just watched the 1st episode from Disc One, Season One of this series. The music was dead-on accurate. It had the correct title music and the correct music for the ending credits, and I didn't hear any "altered new background music" in the body of the show. I'm a fairly reliable cultural historian of things occurring during my childhood (I was 14 when this series debuted). While I don't claim to be of "Trekkie"-level extremism when it comes to 'My Three Sons', I swear that that IF the original music was removed (acccording to reviews from recent years), it's back and correct now! I'll be interested to see what other's current observations are.I'll update this review if I find that subsequent episodes from Disc One, Season One have the original music replaced or altered.
summary: Was issue about the music resolved????

reviewText: Thank goodness they finally getting around to releasing this wonderful show! I hope all the seasons are released soon.If it weren't for our collection of the old classic shows we'd have nothing to watch.The networks seem to think we all like Reality TV which is far from the truth. They also think Sex sells which is also not true for many of us.They are leaving out a very large demographic group of people who are left with nothing.TV Land used to show all the good old classic shows but even they have moved away from the heartwarming, feel good family shows. I went to the TV Land message boards but after looking at all the listings of old shows and all the pleas for old shows to be brought back I understood that they no longer care what we want.We have now stopped even watching that channel.Again who ever releases this DVD, A BIG Thank You and we hope to see the rest very soon!

reviewText: I remember growing up watching the color episodes of "My Three Sons" and never really liking the show that much. It seemed very unrealistic and idealized to me. I especially disliked the very late shows when Fred MacMurray's character, Steve Douglas, got remarried and adopted that annoying little girl.When my family got Nick-At-Nite in the late 80s I recall seeing the early black and white episodes and being amazed. Those early shows were (IMHO) miles above the later shows. The characters were more realistically written and portrayed and the family situations reminded me more of my own childhood (coming from a family with two older brothers myself). The whole attitude of the early episodes was very much unlike other family sitcoms of that era. The Cleavers, Stones, Nelsons, etc., lived in tidy suburban perfection while the Douglas family's world was much rougher around the edges. The kids even kept their rooms messy like real boys would. I found myself hooked on the classic B&W; "My Three Sons"!So, what made the early seasons so much better than the color shows? Well, for me it would have to be William Frawley as grandpa Bub. Yes, he is a bit cranky and short-tempered at times but you knew he loved the kids and would do anything for them. I really think he was the heart and soul of the early shows. It's also really kind of funny that old, crusty Bub took pride in being the "woman of the house." He earned that title by doing all the cooking, cleaning, laundry and child rearing in the absence of Steve Douglas. I never really liked Uncle Charley in the later episodes. He just seemed too mean-spirited to me. Frawley had that gruff exterior but we always knew he was a real mush underneath.I also really enjoyed the dynamic between the original "Three Sons." I had never seen eldest son Mike before Nick-At-Nite's repeats. I really liked what he brought to the series. Middle son Robbie's jealousy of and rivalry with Mike was a very true-to-life aspect of the show as well. Robbie is quite goofy and awkward in the early seasons and often felt overshadowed by Mike, who seemed to excel at everything. Chip as a little kid was a lot of fun too.ABOUT THIS DVD RELEASE:First, the good news. The picture quality is outstanding. The images are crisp and clear and every bit as good as any quality DVD release of this era. Time wise the shows don't seem to be edited as they run about 26 minutes long.Now, the bad news. If you have read some of the other reviews or have researched this DVD release online you have, no doubt, read about the controversy surrounding the incidental music. I have no clue why CBS/Paramount would replace the music cues but I, like most fans, think it's a horrible decision. One of the things I vividly remember about seeing these on Nick-At-Nite was the background music. It was unlike anything else from it's time... very quirky and distinctive. Even stranger, as my online investigation revealed, episode one and episode three on this set contain the original scores. How'd they manage to use the original music cues for those two yet they couldn't (or wouldn't) on the other 15 episodes? I also wonder how, if it was a financial decision, it could have been cheaper to rescore these shows rather than use the original music. How expensive could 48 year-old background music be?The fact that CBS/Paramount is releasing half season sets bugs me too. If they didn't alter the music I could ignore this one but giving fans a half season of altered episodes at full season prices isn't fair.FINAL THOUGHTS:If you liked the color episodes of "My Three Sons" (and maybe even if you didn't) you'll probably enjoy the early shows. My buying advice would be to pick this set up if you are a fan as I doubt they will ever release it again and very likely will never get the whole series released.I'd give "My Three Sons" a full five stars but would give this release (because of the music and half season issues) only 3 stars.
summary: "My Three Sons" DVD set one... a hit and a miss

reviewText: I was looking forward to buying the entire first season of My Three Sons as it originally aired, until I found out it was Paramount up to old tricks yet again, like changing the music (how could they take out the DeVol's score for this show. It's like having pancakes without the syrup), then also releasing half season sets for the price of what a whole season should cost. That's SHAMEFUL and GREEDY of Paramount.DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT PEOPLE, YOU'RE BEING GYPED!I was also looking forward to buying the first season because I only saw the color episodes when I was a kid. I guess I'll be hanging on to those half dozen Columbia House videos I have with the complete and UNEDITED showsPARAMOUNT, YOU'RE A BIG JOKE. Shame on you you're not getting my money!
summary: PARAMOUNT - UP TO IT'S TRICKS AGAIN
